meanings.definition: A person or thing that thwacks.
meanings.sent1: The thwacker swung the bat with all their might.
meanings.sent2: I saw a thwacker hitting the ball at the park.
meanings.sent3: The thwacker at the game had a powerful swing.
meanings.sent4: The thwacker of jokes in our group always makes us laugh.
meanings.sent5: The thwacker in the band played the drums with great skill.

meanings.definition: To strike or beat with a thwacking sound.
meanings.sent1: She thwackered the table to get everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter thwackered the nail into the wood.
meanings.sent3: He thwackered the door closed in frustration.
meanings.sent4: The rain thwackered against the window all night.
meanings.sent5: The chef thwackered the garlic to release its flavor.

meanings.definition: A loud, sharp sound made by hitting something.
meanings.sent1: The thwacker of the hammer echoed through the room.
meanings.sent2: I heard a thwacker coming from the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The thwacker of the gavel silenced the courtroom.
meanings.sent4: The thwacker of the fireworks lit up the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The thwacker of the thunderstorm kept me awake all night.
